result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul R Ceretto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 52 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Paid in full.

Sex Offender Evaluation and Follow through with any recommended treatment. 
3/29/2021 - Court amends sentence to Lifetime Sex Offender Registration.

Not to use or possess any child pornography. No unsupervised contact with minor children. (Only exception is family members) Not to use or possess any electronic devices that have internet access accept for purposes of employment and only with the agent's approval. 
Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 52 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 4

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt: Uploaded to DOC-MAM

08:39 AM Defendant Paul R Ceretto by Zoom (video), in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalia Gess, appeared by Zoom (video) for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court addresses the DOC letter filed 1/11/21.  Statements by defendant.  Statements by the State.  For the reasons stated on the record the court grants the request of the DOC and orders the Judgment of Conviction amended to change the 15 year Sex Offender Registration to a Lifetime Sex Offender Registration.

records.addlTxt:
Adam Stuart appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Paul R Ceretto in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 4:
Total Prison:  6.5 Years.
Initial Confiment:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3.5 Years.
52 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 5.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Sex Offender Evaluation and Follow-Through with any recommended treatment.
Compliance with Sex Offender Registry for a period of 15 years.
Not to use or possess any child pornography.
No unsupervised contact with minor children (only exception is family members).
Not to use or possess any electronic devices that have internet access accept for purposes of employment and only with the agents approval.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

Child Porn Surcharge:  $2,500 (5 images x $500 each).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  







Count 5:
Total Prison:  6.5 Years.
Initial Confiment:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3.5 Years.
52 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 4.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as Count 4.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
Apply Bail - Balance to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


Defendant remanded to the custody to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Character letter filed by Atty Kuhary.
